title: DLI Persian Basic Course (1966) PDS's+Audio
description:
Defense Language Institute Persian Basic Course (1966) with PDF's+Audio


The Persian basic course is designed for use in the Defense Language Institute's intensive programs. The course, employing the audiolingual methodology, is designed to train native English speakers to level three proficiency in comprehension and speaking and level two proficiency in reading and writing Persian. A section on vocabulary provides for each word a transcription of the word with symbols adopted from "Webster's Collegiate Dictionary," the meaning of the word in English, and the word in the Persian alphabet.


Notes/Contents:


1. Eight volumes representing 100 lessons and a ninth volume for a reader.

2. Audio (not split) for volumes 2-8 only (no audio for volume 1).

3. No audio for the perception drills for any of the volumes.
